Comment: Mini-tournament, I'm playing black. White picks an interesting opening. I can't even find a name for this one except in the GK DB, the Amar (Paris) Opening.

The rook sacrifice is barely even a sacrifice since black will win back all the material with interest. Suddenly the knight on d5 must be feeling all alone, with no defender, and paralyzed where he stands.

Forking king and knight. After 27. Kc1 27. cxb3, 28. Ke1 Bxc3+ the new fork will be king and rook. White would be better off with 28. Ne2 Bxa1 and black is a whole rook ahead. Instead, white resigned.
